page.title: 15Farming
page.content: {Manor Farm}is in the small village of{Gamston.}It is farmed by Mr. Potts and his son. They have lived there for fifteen years. The farm at present covers 148 acres but there are fears that much of it will be used for a new housing development in the near future. The farm buildings are very old and were once the stables of a posting house for horse-drawn vehicles travelling to Nottingham. On the wall of one of them has been carved Ruth May 1826-October 1837. Mr. Potts thinks she may have been a servant girl who worked there for that time. Mr. Potts also has a very interesting collection of old farm tools.
